metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6829 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When performing EC scalar point multiplication, the wNAF pointmultiplication algorithm was used; which leaked partial information aboutthe nonce used during signature generation. Given an electro-magnetic traceof a few signature generations, the private key could have been computed.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
No subscription required

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.13').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
